meanings.definition: Having or showing an excessively high opinion of one's appearance, abilities, or worth.
meanings.sent1: She was so vain that she spent hours admiring herself in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: His vain attempts to impress others with his wealth only made him look foolish.
meanings.sent3: In a vain attempt to be the center of attention, she wore a bright pink hat to the party.
meanings.sent4: His vanity was like a mirror that reflected only his own image, blinding him to the world around him.
meanings.sent5: The peacock's vain display of its colorful feathers captivated all who saw it.

meanings.sent1: The broken clock was vain, unable to tell the correct time.
meanings.sent2: His efforts to fix the leaky faucet were in vain as it continued to drip.
meanings.sent3: Trying to teach a cat to bark is as vain as trying to make a rock float in water.
meanings.sent4: Her words fell on his ears like vain echoes, leaving no impact on his decision.
meanings.sent5: The wilted flower's vain attempt to bloom again showed the cycle of life.

meanings.definition: Without success or a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: He searched vainly for his lost keys in the dark room.
meanings.sent2: She called out vainly for help, but no one heard her cries in the deserted alley.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to reach the bird feeder in vain, unable to overcome the obstacle.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed against the shore vainly, unable to erode the solid rock.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled vainly through the empty streets, carrying whispers of forgotten tales.
